thing-type.label: GoControl GC-TBZ48 Z-Wave Plus Thermostat
thing-type.description: Z-Wave Plus Thermostat<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe Z-Wave Thermostat (GC-TBZ48) is a programmable, Z-Wave communications thermostat. It can be powered using 24VAC (if both “R”&”C”wires are available at the thermostat), or using four (4) AA batteries. Using Z-Wave technology, end users have the ability to use the 2GIG Go!Control panel to control the thermostat, configure programming settings, as well as to display current conditions in the home or office.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSet your primary controller to Include, add or Install mode, to add the thermostat as a node on your network (see your controller’s user manual for detailed instructions).</li&gt <li&gtPress any button to take thermostat out of sleep mode.</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold FAN button for 5 seconds. SETUP will be displayed in the status display line.</li&gt <li&gtScroll to “Z-Wave” using up/down buttons. Press SELECT.</li&gt <li&gtWhen prompted by your Z-Wave controller, Press the YES button in the Z-Wave Install screen.</li&gt <li&gtPress SELECT (mode button) to add thermostat to network.</li&gt <li&gtDisplay line should flash WAIT then SUCCESS if Z-Wave connection is made.</li&gt <li&gtIf Z-Wave does not connect to controller, WAIT, then FAIL will flash in status display line.</li&gt <li&gtIf thermostat fails to connect, repeat Steps three (3) through (7) to re-try connecting.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSet your primary controller to Include, add or Install mode, to add the thermostat as a node on your network (see your controller’s user manual for detailed instructions).</li&gt <li&gtPress any button to take thermostat out of sleep mode.</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold FAN button for 5 seconds. SETUP will be displayed in the status display line.</li&gt <li&gtScroll to “Z-Wave” using up/down buttons. Press SELECT.</li&gt <li&gtWhen prompted by your Z-Wave controller, Press the YES button in the Z-Wave Install screen.</li&gt <li&gtPress SELECT (mode button) to add thermostat to network.</li&gt <li&gtDisplay line should fl ash WAIT then SUCCESS if Z-Wave connection is made.</li&gt <li&gtIf Z-Wave does not connect to controller, WAIT, then FAIL will flash in status display line. </li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: System Type
parameter.description: System Type

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Fan Type
parameter.description: Fan Type<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0 = Gas (no fan w/Heat)</li&gt <li&gt1 = Electric (Fan w/Heat)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 3: Change Over Type
parameter.description: Change Over Type

parameter.label: 4: 2nd Stage Heat Enable
parameter.description: 2nd Stage Heat Enable

parameter.label: 6: 2nd Stage Cool Enable
parameter.description: 2nd Stage Cool Enable

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Temperature Unit
parameter.description: Temperature Unit

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Minimum Off Time
parameter.description: Minimum Off Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the Minimum Off Time (MOT) delay before another heating/cooling cycle can begin</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Minimum Run Time
parameter.description: Minimum Run Time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the Minimum Run Time (MRT) delay before a heating/cooling cycle can turn off</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Setpoint H/C Delta
parameter.description: Setpoint H/C Delta<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the minimum separation between heating and cooling setpoints</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: H Delta Stage 1 ON
parameter.description: H Delta Stage 1 ON<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating starts</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: H Delta Stage 1 OFF
parameter.description: H Delta Stage 1 OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating stops</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: H Delta Stage 2 ON
parameter.description: H Delta Stage 2 ON<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating starts</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: H Delta Stage 2 OFF
parameter.description: H Delta Stage 2 OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating stops</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: H Delta Aux ON
parameter.description: H Delta Aux ON<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating starts</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: H Delta Stage 3 OFF
parameter.description: H Delta Stage 3 OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating stops</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: C Delta Stage 1 ON
parameter.description: C Delta Stage 1 ON<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling starts</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_1
parameter.label: 18: C Delta Stage 1 OFF
parameter.description: C Delta Stage 1 OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling stops</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: C Delta Stage 2 ON
parameter.description: C Delta Stage 2 ON<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling starts</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: C Delta Stage 2 OFF
parameter.description: C Delta Stage 2 OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling stops</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_23_4
parameter.label: 23: Lifeline Association Group Report To Send
parameter.description: Lifeline Association Group Report To Send<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtReport to send to the Lifeline Association Group upon change in thermostat state. </p&gt <p&gtBitmask values:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1 = Temperature</li&gt <li&gt2 = Heat Setpoint</li&gt <li&gt4 = Cool Setpoint</li&gt <li&gt8 = Thermostat Heat/Cooling Mode</li&gt <li&gt16 = Fan Mode</li&gt <li&gt32 = Fan State</li&gt <li&gt64 = Operating State</li&gt <li&gt128 = Schedule (send CC parameter 38)</li&gt <li&gt256 = Setback (send CC parameter 40)</li&gt <li&gt512 = Run Hold (send CC parameter 39)</li&gt <li&gt1024 = Display Lock (send CC parameter 24)</li&gt <li&gt8192 = Battery Level</li&gt <li&gt16834 = Mechanical Relay State (send CC parameter 21)</li&gt <li&gt32768 = Thermostat State Config (send CC parameter 22) </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Display Lock
parameter.description: Display Lock

parameter.name: config_26_1
parameter.label: 26: Backlight Timer
parameter.description: Backlight Timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the time from last button press that the backlight will turn OFF</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_1
parameter.label: 33: Max Heat Setpoint
parameter.description: Max Heat Setpoint<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the maximum heating setpoint value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_34_1
parameter.label: 34: Min Cool Setpoint
parameter.description: Min Cool Setpoint<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the minimum cooling setpoint value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_38_1
parameter.label: 38: Schedule Enable
parameter.description: Schedule Enable<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable or disable thermostat's local scheduler</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_39_1
parameter.label: 39: Run/Hold Mode
parameter.description: Run/Hold Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 = Hold, 1 = Run</p&gt</p&gt
